item.title: PRI vs POTS Telephone Service
item.description:
Business telephone systems come in various sizes, from single-line setups to large enterprise systems with thousands of phones. This article aims to help you determine the right system size for your business needs. The most basic phone service is known as POTS, or Plain Old Telephone Service, although it’s often marketed as a business line or dial-tone service. This service provides an analog connection to the nearest telephone company’s Central Office (CO)...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/pri-vs-pots-telephone-service/

item.title: T1 Voice Options for Call Quality
item.description:
For businesses reliant on phone communication, exceptional call quality is non-negotiable. This means clear, natural-sounding voices with minimal disruptions like dropped calls, echoes, or choppy audio. If this resonates, T1 voice service might be your solution. T1 lines are a natural fit for business phone systems as they were intentionally designed for this purpose. T-Carrier technology, including T1 (1.5 Mbps) and T3 (45 Mbps), was initially developed for use by phone companies...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/t1-voice-options-for-call-quality/
